derivation: a primitive root; to clip off; specifically (as denominative from H1210 (בָּצִיר))
outline:
1. to gather, restrain, fence, fortify, make inaccessible, enclose
    1. (Qal)
      1. to cut off
      2. fortified, cut off, made inaccessible (pass participle)
      3. secrets, mysteries, inaccessible things (subst)
    2. (Niphal) to be withheld
    3. (Piel) to fortify
kjv_def: cut off, (de-) fenced, fortify, (grape) gather(-er), mighty things, restrain, strong, wall (up), withhold.
strongs_def: to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification)
